alert.note: Alert for Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 2:21AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Sublette and west central Lincoln Counties through 245 AM MDT... At 220 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Smoot, which is also 9 miles southwest of Afton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Smoot and Salt River Pass around 225 AM MDT. Mount Wagner around 235 AM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mount Coffin, Corral Creek Guard Station, Wyoming Peak and Middle Piney Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Star Valley
